title: Home and Community Support Services Agencies (HCSSA)
description: Information about the licensing and regulation of home and community support services agencies (HCSSAs) in Texas.
cleaned_text: What is a HCSSA? Home and community support services agencies (HCSSAs) provide services such as: - nursing; - physical, occupational, speech, respiratory or intravenous therapy; - social services; - dialysis; - personal assistance services; - nutritional counseling; and - terminal and palliative care (through hospice agencies) to individuals in a residence or independent living environment. [Hospice agencies](/providers/long-term-care-providers/hospice) and hospice inpatient facilities provide intervention services that focus primarily on the reduction or abatement of physical, psychological, or spiritual symptoms of a terminal illness for consumers. They also provide support services for consumers and their families.
